size

public int size()
Number of beans returned by query.

This method is called extremely often. We store the result to avoid invoking the query.

addToMapping

protected void addToMapping(com.vaadin.data.Item item,
                            Object keyPropertyId,
                            int index)
Call back to the cache(s).

The view can maintain a cache or mappings of what it has retrieved. In the current implementation, we map the keys to their corresponding index in the container

Parameters:
item - the item being added
keyPropertyId - the key being used (the real key from the database)
index - the index in the container

saveItems

public void saveItems(List<com.vaadin.data.Item> addedItems,
                      List<com.vaadin.data.Item> modifiedItems,
                      List<com.vaadin.data.Item> removedItems)
Saves the modifications done by container to the query result. Query will be discarded after changes have been saved and new query loaded so that changed items are sorted appropriately.

Specified by:
saveItems in interface org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.Query
Parameters:
addedItems - Items to be inserted.
modifiedItems - Items to be updated.
removedItems - Items to be deleted.

deleteAllItems

public boolean deleteAllItems()
Removes all items. Query will be discarded after delete all items has been called.

Specified by:
deleteAllItems in interface org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.Query
Returns:
true if the operation succeeded or false in case of a failure.

adjustRetrievalBoundaries

protected void adjustRetrievalBoundaries(javax.persistence.TypedQuery<javax.persistence.Tuple> typedQuery,
                                         int startIndex,
                                         int count)
Compute lower bound and number of tuples to retrieve. If batching is used, the bounds are adjusted to fit on batch sizes: for example for getBatchSize() = 100, and a call with startIndex = 110, count = 100: we need at least 110 to 209. Aligning will yield batchLowBoundary = 100, and count = 200, and will retrieve 100 to 299,

Parameters:
typedQuery - the query being adjusted
startIndex - starting position for retrieval
count - how many items to retrieve
